Rosemont / [[Saint Denis Street|rue Saint-Denis]] [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Rosemont.pdf Rosemont Station Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''Rosemont''' is a [[metro station|station]] on the [[Line 2 Orange (Montreal Metro)|Orange Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located in the borough of [[RosemontâLa Petite-Patrie]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m07.htm Rosemont Metro Station]. The station opened on October 14, 1966, as part of the original network of the metro. == Overview == The metro station, designed by Duplessis, Labelle et Derome, is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in [[tunnel]]. It has a ticket barrier at [[Transept#Other senses of the word|transept]] level leading to a single entrance adjacent to a [[bus loop]] and a municipal parking lot. ==Origin of the name== This station is named for boulevard Rosemont, the main street of the Rosemont district. This area was developed on an area purchased by land speculators Ucal-Henri Dandurand and Herbert Holt from the [[Canadian Pacific Railway]]; it was incorporated as the Village of Rosemont in 1915, named by Dandurand in honour of his mother, nÃ©e Rose Phillips. ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
